questions.question: Q1: Identify the pointed structure and mention its arterial supply?
questions.modelAnswer:
fibrous pericardium lined by parietal layer of serous pericardium.
Arterial supply:
1) Pericardiophrenic artery.
2) Descending thoracic aorta .
3) Internal thoracic artery .

questions.question: Q2: Identify the pointed structure and mention its nerve supply?
questions.modelAnswer:
fibrous pericardium lined by praital layer of serous pericardium.
Nerve supply:
1) Left and right phrenic nerves.
2) Intercostal nerves.

questions.question: Q3: Identify the pointed structure and mention its sinuses?
questions.modelAnswer:
fibrous pericardium lined by praital layer of serous pericardium .
Sinuses:
1) Transverse sinus.
2) Oblique sinus.

questions.question: Q4: Identify the pointed structure and mention its ligaments?
questions.modelAnswer:
fibrous pericardium lined by praital layer of serous pericardium.
Ligaments:
1) Superior and inferior sternopericardial ligaments.
2) Pericardiophrenic ligament.

questions.question: Q5: Identify the numbering areas?
questions.modelAnswer:
Opened pericardium showing the anterior surface of the heart and great vessels:
1) Fibrous pericardium.
2) Right ventricle.
3) Pulmonary trunk.
4) Ascending aorta.
5) Arch of aorta.
6) Superior vena cava (SVC).
7) Ligamentum arteriosum.

questions.question: Q5: Identify the numbering areas?
questions.modelAnswer:
Opened pericardium showing the anterior surface of the heart and great vessels:
8) Inferior vena cava (IVC).
9) Pulmonary trunk and valve.
10) Ascending aorta and valve.
11) Left pulmonary veins.
12) Oblique sinus.

questions.question: Q6: Identify the area related to the white arrow?
questions.modelAnswer: Transverse sinus of serous pericardium.

questions.question: Q7: Identify the area related to the yellow arrow?
questions.modelAnswer: Oblique sinus of serous pericardium.

questions.question: Q8: Identify the numbering areas??
questions.modelAnswer:
1) IVC.
2) Right pulmonary veins.
3) SVC.
4) Ascending aorta.
5) Arch of aorta.
6) Brachiocephalic artery (innominate artery).
7) Left common carotid artery.
8) Left subclavian artery.
9) Pulmonary trunk.
10) Right border of heart made by right atrium and covered by fibrous pericardium.

questions.question: Q9: Identify the pointed numbers?
questions.modelAnswer:
1) Right atrium.
2) Right ventricle.
3) Left ventricle.
4) Arch of aorta.
5) Brachiocephalic artery.
6) Left common carotid artery.
7) Left subclavian artery.

questions.question: Q9: Identify the pointed numbers?
questions.modelAnswer:
:
8. Left atrium
9. Left ventricle
10. Atrioventricular groove or coronary sulcus

questions.question: Q10: Identify the pointed structures?
questions.modelAnswer:
A. Right coronary artery
B. Left coronary giving circumflex branch
C. Left anterior descending or anterior interventricular artery
D. Arch of aorta

questions.question: Q12: Identify the pointed structures?
questions.modelAnswer:
A. Left ventricle
B. Trabeculae carneae and papillary muscles
C. Interventricular septum
D. Right ventricle

questions.question: Q13: Identify the numbering areas?
questions.modelAnswer:
1. Apex of heart
2. Left ventricular wall
3. Papillary muscle
4. Interventricular septum
5. Right ventricle
6. Opening of IVC
7. Opening of SVC
8. Pulmonary trunk
9. Ascending aorta
10. Arch of aorta

questions.question: Q14: Identify the pointed structures?
questions.modelAnswer:
1. Tricuspid valve
2. Right coronary artery
3. Aorta and aortic valve
4. Pulmonary artery & valve
5. Left coronary artery
6. Mitral valve

questions.question: Q15: Identify the cardiac anomales?
questions.modelAnswer: atrial septal defect

questions.question: Q16: Identify the cardiac anomales?
questions.modelAnswer: Ventricular Septal Defect

questions.question: Q17: Identify the cardiac anomales?
questions.modelAnswer: Ventricular Septal Defect (VSD)

questions.question: Q18: Identify the cardiac anomales?
questions.modelAnswer: teratology of fallot

questions.question: Q19: Identify the cardiac anomales?
questions.modelAnswer: patent ductus arteriosus

questions.question: Q20: Identify the pointed structure and mention two branches?
questions.modelAnswer:
arch of aorta
1)Brachiocephalic artery.
2) Left common carotid artery.
3) Left subclavian artery.

questions.question: Q21: Identify the pointed structure and mention the level of its termination?
questions.modelAnswer:
Arch of aorta.
Termination: at the lower border of the body of thoracic vertebra number 4.

questions.question: Q22: Identify the pointed structure and mention two tributaries?
questions.modelAnswer:
left Brachiocephalic vein
1) Left internal jugular vein.
2) Left subclavian vein.

questions.question: Q23: Identify the pointed structure and mention its termination?
questions.modelAnswer:
Left brachiocephalic vein.
Termination: union with right brachiocephalic vein at the level of right 1st costal cartilage to form the SVC.

questions.question: Q24: Identify the numbering areas?
questions.modelAnswer:
1. Celiac trunk
2. Common hepatic artery
3. Superior mesenteric artery
4. IVC
5. Right common iliac
6. Right External iliac
7. Inferior mesenteric artery
8. Abdominal aorta
9. Splenic artery
10. Left renal artery

questions.question: Q25: Identify the pointed structure (1) and mention two branches?
questions.modelAnswer:
Right common carotid artery
1. Rt External carotid artery
2. Rt Internal carotid artery

questions.question: Q26: Identify the pointed structure (2) and mention the level of its beginning?
questions.modelAnswer:
Right external carotid artery
Begins at level of intervertebral disc between cervical vertebrea number 3 and 4

questions.question: Q27: Identify the pointed structure (3) and mention two branches?
questions.modelAnswer:
Right internal carotid artery
1. Anterior cerebral artery
2. middle cerebral artery
